metadata.title: Development of Lemongrass Essential Oil Incorporated Films Based on Sodium Alginate
metadata.authors: Cofelice, M., Cuomo, F., & Lopez, F.

data_extracted.film_development:
1. Primary emulsions prepared by mixing LEO (0.5–2.5% w/w) as lipidic phase and Tween 80 
        (1.5% w/w) as surface active agent in an aqueous suspension of sodium alginate (1% w/w).
        2. Homogenization with an Ultra-Turrax rotor-stator homogenizer at 20000 rpm for 4 min.
        3. Ultrasonic treatment for 20 min at 40% amplitude with 1 s pulses.
        4. Film-forming dispersions with LEO by mixing primary emulsions into alginate solution.
        5. Spreading formulation on Teflon disks and drying at room temperature (RH 45–50%).
        6. Equilibration at 25 °C in desiccators containing Mg(NO3)2.
        7. Crosslinking with CaCl2 0.1 M solution.
data_extracted.materials: Food-grade sodium alginate, Tween 80, Lemongrass Essential Oil (LEO), Calcium chloride, Mg(NO3)2, P2O5, and ultra-pure water.
